channel.title: Modulation options
channel.description:
Hi All, Inspired by the Matrixbrute I've decided to stick a tiny mod matrix onto my hardware synth using a Adafruit Trellis and Teensy. I'm familiar with normal subtractive synthesis but I'm stuck to find a 4th modulation option. Here's my mod matrix so far.
| * | LFO | LFO2 | ENV | | Pitch | | | | | PWM | | | | | LFO1 | | | | | Filter | | | |
So I have 2 lfo's and an env. Is there something else more interesting I can stick in there?

item.title: Modulation options
item.dc:creator: @mongrol
item.description:
@mongrol wrote:

Steady. I'll looking at a 8x8 grid of trellises (Trelli?) at this rate.

Been playing with rand/uniform. Took a bit of fiddling but I have a nice random mod source now. I need to wind back and do a count of pots I need. I'm sure I'm over and will end up using teensy knobs as well. Tsk. Scope creep!

Read full topic

item.title: Modulation options
item.dc:creator: @JSZ
item.description:
@JSZ wrote:

Pitch is a good modulation source.

Read full topic

item.title: Modulation options
item.dc:creator: @mongrol
item.description:
@mongrol wrote:

Yeah, just thought while out and about a random thing would be awesome. I'm also short of targets as I've missed off the VCA. So something like this;

| *      | LFO | LFO2 | ENV | Random
| Pitch  |     |      |     |
| PWM    |     |      |     |
| Vol   |     |      |     |
| Filter |     |      |     |

Hmm, saying that being able to LFO an LFO would be good and I could fake Vol modulation with the filter.

Read full topic

item.title: Modulation options
item.dc:creator: @mrdrbobo
item.description:
@mrdrbobo wrote:

As mod sources:
Velocity
Aftertouch
Any exotic sensor, like sharp ir distance sensor.
Or do you mean something else?

Read full topic

item.description:
@mongrol wrote:

Hi All,
Inspired by the Matrixbrute I've decided to stick a tiny mod matrix onto my hardware synth using a Adafruit Trellis and Teensy. I'm familiar with normal subtractive synthesis but I'm stuck to find a 4th modulation option. Here's my mod matrix so far.
